results.title: Harry, he is here to help = Harry, un ami qui vous veut du bien
results.creator_credit: Diaphana Films, Michel Saint-Jean and Dominik Moll
results.brief_description: Described as black comedy “Harry, he is here to help” is a taut serial killer thriller, “Hitchcockian” in tone. Sergi Lopez plays Harry, a wealthy man of independent means, given to acts of largesse, who runs into an old school chum, Michel, in the lavatory of a service station. Michel, married with three daughters, is in financial straits with a country family retreat that is in essence a money pit. Recalling Michel’s juvenile high school poetry, and believing that Michel has lost his artistic drive due to domestic demands, Harry insinuates himself in order to ‘fix’ Michel’s life. Harry, a handsome, sexually avaricious and amiable sociopath, is capable of a seemingly ceaseless slew of deaths in his determination to enable Michel to fulfill artistic aspirations. The friendly fiendish stranger, who poses a threat to the nuclear family, is familiar in cinema, driving such films as “Strangers on a train” and “Fatal attraction”. Moll offers few fresh insights into such narrative ploys other than proffering a spin in regards to Michel’s suppressed art, and the homoeroticism of the male lead, as he eliminates the perilous reproducers - the female presence. Cast includes: Laurent Lucas, Sergi Lopez, Mathilde Seigner, Sophie Guillemin, Liliane Rovere, Dominique Rozan.

results.title: Harry the dirty dog (K)
results.brief_description: Harry, a white dog with black spots, enjoys playing in the sprinklers, climbing trees, and especially doing tricks. his first adventure is with an overturned trash can, and eventually he is picked up by a garbage truck and carried to a far away dump. Man adventures later he returns home, a dirtier, wiser dog. Based on the book of the same title by Gene Zion.

results.title: Harry Potter and the philosopher's stone [DVD]
results.creator_credit: 1492 Pictures, Heyday Films, David Heyman and Chris Columbus
results.brief_description: A stunning visual adaptation of the novel of the same name by British author J.K. Rowling. 10 year old Harry Potter, orphaned as an infant and raised by his horrible aunt and uncle, believes himself to be an ordinary boy, only to find out on his eleventh birthday that he is anything but ordinary. Harry is a wizard and has been accepted at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry where he will spend the next seven years following in his parent’s footsteps. Spells, charms, potions, Quidditch - every young wizard’s favourite sport, dragons, trolls, three-headed dogs and discovering the truth behind his parent’s not-so-accidental death means never-ending adventures for Harry and his friends Hermione and Ron. Newcomers Daniel Radcliffe, Emma Watson and Rupert Grint star as Harry, Hermione and Ron. Cast also includes Richard Harris, Maggie Smith, Alan Rickman, Robbie Coltrane, John Cleese, Fiona Shaw, Zoe Wanamaker, Julie Walters, John Hurt, Ian Hart, Richard Griffiths and Warwick Davis.

results.title: Harry Potter and the chamber of secrets
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, David Heyman and Chris Columbus
results.brief_description: The second instalment in the Harry Potter series returns to Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, in what is arguably a stronger film than its predecessor, despite belief that the novel on which the film is based, is the weakest in the series. An enchanting musical score and solid animation are supported by strong performances of young actors Daniel Radcliff, Emma Watson and Rupert Grint, who reprise their roles as Harry, Hermione and Ron. Between dealing with cryptic house-elves, flying cars, Quidditch, and attempting to keep one step ahead of the nasty Slytherins, who has time to study? However, when muggle-born students are being attacked, it is once again up to Harry and his friends to save the day. The all-star British cast includes Jason Isaacs as the malicious Lucius Malfoy and Kenneth Branagh as pompous professor Gilderoy Lockhart who join Richard Harris, in one of his final roles, Maggie Smith, Alan Rickman, Robbie Coltrane, John Cleese, Fiona Shaw, Zoe Wanamaker, Julie Walters, John Hurt, Ian Hart, Richard Griffiths and Warwick Davis. Based on the novel by J.K. Rowling.
